import React from 'react' import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag' import { Playground, PropsTable, Link } from 'docz' import Planet from '../../orbitStories/Planet' import Planets from '../../orbitStories/Planets' import Display from './Display' import Preview from './Preview' import { crudProvider, schema, record, collection } from './texts.js' export default ({components, ...props}) => {`Getting Started`} {`Installation`} {`Install the package:`} yarn add orbit-client {`Configuration`} {`Create occonfig.json in the root of your project:`} { schema } {`Run orbit-client command to create components:`} yarn orbit-client
Note: We use pluralize package to pluralize schema models to Collection component names. If this happens incorrectly you can use the plural prop to correct this. {`Set up a provider to provide orbit-client with your own crud functions:`} { crudProvider }
Note: Orbit-client uses these functions to query sources other than the cache/memory. We use react-orbitjs for querying the cache. You can configure components to only make use of cache or to skip the cache. Learn more about this at the advanced usage section. {`Basic usage`} {`Thats it, you are set to go! Now you can use the components from your previously specified target directory.`} {`Record`} { record } {client => } `} __scope={{props,Planet,Planets,Display,Preview,crudProvider,schema,record,collection}}> {(client) => } {`Collection`} { collection } {client => } `} __scope={{props,Planet,Planets,Display,Preview,crudProvider,schema,record,collection}}> {(client) => }
